results.title: A Short story about love
results.creator_credit: Karen Wootton and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Karen is young, travelling and in love. When she returns from her travels she discovers she has HIV and with this diagnosis her life changes. Karen must come to terms with life’s new circumstances as she laments the fact that she may never have another relationship or be a mother. But life does move on for Karen and with the help of friends and family, Karen finds love again.

results.title: The Gift
results.brief_description: Deanna is given a real gift in life, this gift is really challenging but as she begins to understand the nature of this gift she understands its true importance.

results.title: Now I am an Australian
results.brief_description:
An migrated with her family to Australia and settled in Richmond. She is actively involved in the Vietnamese community and works toward keeping Vietnamese culture and traditions alive.
Made at ACMI as part of the ‘Recovering Hope’ Digital Storytelling project, in partnership with VicHealth and Belgium Street Neighbourhood House.

results.title: The Story of an immigrant filmmaker
results.creator_credit: Agnes Karlik and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Agnes was separated from her mother and sisters when she migrated from post war Europe with her father. Her father was a filmmaker and documents their journey on the ship and their arrival to a transit camp in Western Australia. This story uses the footage captured by her father to tell her tale of migration.

results.title: New beginnings
results.creator_credit: Stella Paraskakis and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Migrating to a new country as a young girl can be an overwhelming experience. This story captures the memories of life in a new country by a young girl who migrated to Australia from Greece with her family.
results.description: Migrating to a new country as a young girl can be an overwhelming experience. This story captures the memories of life in a new country by a young girl who migrated to Australia from Greece with her family.

results.title: The Blue Nile
results.creator_credit: Kathrine Deng and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Through civil war Kathrine’s family are forced to change their lives, language and religion and eventually their country. Kathrine and her family are now living in Australia and they feel safe and have a chance to realise their dreams. Kathrine wants to make sure her children understand their cultural heritage and hopes that one day she can show them the Blue Nile.

results.title: A young girls journey to the other side of the world
results.creator_credit: Maria Sourtzis and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: This is a story of migration through the eyes of a young girl. Maria recounts the long journey by boat, the memories of Bonegilla migrant reception centre and her early life in Melbourne.

results.title: Life is beautiful
results.brief_description:
Nga’s children have been her motivating force to search for a better life. Nga reflects upon her family’s journey of migration from Vietnam to Australia. She is proud of her achievements and the achievements of her children.
Made at ACMI as part of the ‘Recovering Hope’ Digital Storytelling project, in partnership with VicHealth and Belgium Street Neighbourhood House.

results.title: A Journey to freedom
results.creator_credit: Helen Schloetzer and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Helen survived life in a German detention camp, her life was completely disrupted by the horror of war. Helen and her family were displaced persons when they migrated to Australia. Helen and her family found themselves transiting to Bonegilla, temporary accommodation for new migrants who had exchanged free or assisted passage to Australia.

results.title: Sudan: a new vision
results.creator_credit: Nychuat Deng and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: A lot of people made sacrifices in an attempt to free South Sudan from civil war. Nychuat and her family now live in Australia but they are deeply connected to Sudan and in honour and respect for those that have made sacrifices, they work tirelessly to support the freedom movement in Sudan. This story explores Nychaut’s relationship with her two countries, Australia and Sudan.
